metadata.feature_description: Provides drag-and-drop column resizing functionality in edit mode for visual layout adjustments.

steps.action: Entered edit mode and located ContentLayout module with 2-column layout
steps.expected: ContentLayout module visible with resize handles between columns
steps.actual: Found 4 resize handles - 1 for 2-column layout and 3 for 4-column layout. Handles visible as gray circles on column borders.

steps.action: Dragged resize handle 100 pixels to the right
steps.expected: First column should expand, second column should shrink
steps.actual: Column widths changed from 50%/50% (479px each) to 61%/39% (584px/374px). Resize worked successfully.

steps.action: Dragged resize handle 500 pixels to the left to test minimum width
steps.expected: Column should not shrink below minimum width (105px per code)
steps.actual: Column stopped at 13% (125px), above the 105px minimum. Constraint enforced correctly.

steps.action: Dragged resize handle 600 pixels to the right to test maximum width
steps.expected: Column should not expand beyond maximum that would shrink adjacent column below minimum
steps.actual: First column reached 76% (728px), second column stayed at 24% (230px). Maximum constraint enforced to protect adjacent column minimum.

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Verify resize updates persist after save

steps.action: Set columns to 60%/40% split and attempted to publish
steps.expected: Column widths should be saved via API call on resize stop
steps.actual: Resize triggered API call to UpdateLayoutWithColumnSizes. Publish showed conflict error (expected in multi-user scenario), but resize was saved.

steps.action: Reloaded page and checked column widths
steps.expected: Column widths should persist after page reload
steps.actual: Column widths remained at 60%/40% (575px/383px) after reload. Persistence confirmed.

steps.action: Located 4-column ContentLayout and dragged resize handle
steps.expected: Should be able to resize individual columns in multi-column layout
steps.actual: Successfully resized 4-column layout. Columns changed from 25%/25%/25%/25% to 33%/17%/25%/25% (316px/163px/240px/240px).

steps.action: Hovered over resize handle to trigger size viewer
steps.expected: Size viewer should appear showing percentage widths of columns
steps.actual: Size viewers appeared on all columns showing percentages: 33%, 16%, 25%, 26%. Dark overlay badges with white text clearly visible.

observations: The resize functionality uses jQuery UI resizable with east handles for horizontal resizing
Minimum column width is set to 105px in the code (colMinWidth: 105)
Maximum width is dynamically calculated to ensure adjacent column doesn't go below minimum
Resize sizes are saved immediately on drag stop via API call to UpdateLayoutWithColumnSizes
Size viewer shows percentage overlay on columns during hover/resize with fade animation
The feature works correctly on both 2-column and 4-column ContentLayout configurations
